attributes.action: Condemn the B.B.C. for blatant bias towards "REMAIN" during the E.U. Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
During Barak Obama's recent visit much of their news broadcasts were given over to him, much time allowed for his views on the campaign to be heard, whereas the LEAVE responses were merely allowed to be fleeting. 

The whole way the BBC present the "arguements" is skewed towards REMAIN.
attributes.background: It is clear that by the nature of the B.B.C. coverage of the E.U. Referendum campaign that it is doing its best to support the "REMAIN" arguement.

rejection.details:
The BBC is an independent body governed by a Royal Charter. Under the terms of that Charter, the BBC is operationally and editorially independent of government and there is no provision for the government to intervene in the BBC’s day-to-day operations.

You can find out about the BBC complaints system here:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/bbctrust/our_work/complaints_and_appeals/
